meanings.definition: Capable of being forgiven or pardoned.
meanings.sent1: The mistake was remissible, so the teacher forgave the student.
meanings.sent2: In a court of law, some offenses are considered remissible under certain circumstances.
meanings.sent3: The cat's remissible act of knocking over the vase was met with a forgiving pat on the head.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was so remissible that it seemed to erase any past wrongs.
meanings.sent5: The remissible nature of his apology made it easy to move past the disagreement.

meanings.definition: Capable of being excused or overlooked.
meanings.sent1: The small error was remissible and did not affect the overall outcome.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes, minor delays are remissible if they do not cause significant problems.
meanings.sent3: His remissible lateness to the meeting was met with understanding by his colleagues.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the garden was so captivating that any flaws became remissible.
meanings.sent5: The remissible oversight was quickly corrected without any lasting consequences.
